jobs.title: Lead Product Designer
jobs.description:
We are building a digital-first platform where creators can meet, discuss what they need to make their ideas happen, find a team, and start projects together. It’s early days but we’re making good progress; a few weeks after our public launch, we’re a community of 100,000+ creators.

We're just getting started. We have a vision for where we want to go and how to evolve Daisie. We’re now looking for a Lead Product Designer to join us and help realise that vision.

As the Lead Product Designer at Daisie, you will:
- collaborate with product and engineering teams to define the customer experience
- have ownership over the interaction and visual design languages of our products
- rapidly prototype concepts and figure out shippable iterations of features
- play an active role in user research and help deduce how we evolve the product
- continue to iterate on the Daisie UI to improve usability
- help establish a culture of design at Daisie

As Daisie grows, the role will also expand to involve building and managing a team of product designers.

We think this role will be suitable for someone with:
- more than 5 years of experience designing and shipping digital products, including consumer mobile applications and responsive websites
- a high level of comfort working embedded within a cross functional team, producing design solutions rapidly to solve problems
- a desire to work at a fast paced, early stage startup, taking advantage of the opportunity to define their role, as well as the product
- an innate understanding of shippable vs perfect, presenting strong opinions, weakly held in light of data and customer feedback

Daisie employees are offered:
- a competitive salary
- equity in the company
- personal training budget to spend as you wish
- all the tools and support you need to create amazing work
- a place in a team excited to make a dent in the world
- daily play time with two Shiba Inus


Application Process

As part of your application, we will expect you to share a portfolio of case studies and examples that highlight functional, thoughtful, beautiful design solutions, with a solid rationale to back up your decisions. 

We will hold a brief video call with shortlisted candidates, following which we will invite you to the Daisie office in Shoreditch to meet the team, spend some time with us, and see how we might work together.

Applications for this role will close 21 June 2019. We can't wait to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.description:
We are building a digital-first platform where creators can meet, discuss what they need to make their ideas happen, find a team, and start projects together. It’s early days but we’re making good progress; a few weeks after our public launch, we’re a community of 100,000+ creators.

We're just getting started. We have a vision for where we want to go and how to evolve Daisie. We’re now looking for a Senior iOS Developer to join us and help realise that vision.

As a Senior iOS Engineer at Daisie, you will:
- work in a close-knit team with two other iOS engineers
- collaborate with the wider Daisie engineering team as well as the product and design teams on technical approach and the customer experience
- prototype concepts and figure out shippable iterations of features

We think this role will be suitable for someone with:
- around five years experience shipping and iterating on consumer iOS applications, with a significant chunk of that experience in Swift
- history of working on mobile applications end to end — from application backend all the way to building rich user interfaces with bespoke animations
- a high level of comfort working embedded within a cross functional team, producing solutions rapidly to solve problems
- a desire to work at a fast paced, early stage startup, taking advantage of the opportunity to define their role, as well as the product
- an understanding of the principles of computer science

All Daisie employees are offered:
- a highly competitive salary
- meaningful equity in the company
- 33 days annual leave (including bank holidays)
- personal training budget to spend as you wish
- all the tools and support you need to create amazing work
- a place in a team excited to make a dent in the world
- daily play time with two Shiba Inus https://instagram.com/shibathewilf & https://instagram.com/raftheshiba
